name: 'Guns Not Butter' Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 4 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which President was restricted from the Senate Cloak room because of incessant lobbying?
questions.explanation:
Benjamin Harrison.

	When Josh was in the Senate Cloak room he was told this.

President Bartlet.

	CJ (to President): "You've got a pretty good sass yourself, sir."

questions.text: How many people thought that there was too much foreign aid?
questions.explanation:
68%.

	Josh (to Will): "Because 68 percent think we give too much in foreign aid, and 59 percent think it should be cut."

questions.text: What name did Donna call Will?
What department did Charlie call about the food stamps?
questions.explanation:
Defense.

	In response, they sent a booklet to the White House and several other advisors.

questions.text: Did a cow arrive at the White House?
questions.explanation:
No.

	A goat arrived named Ron. CJ put him in Will's new office to help Josh and Toby haze the new guy.

questions.text: What did Leo say he was going to hide in CJ's car?
questions.explanation:
Snakes.

	Leo (to CJ): "If the President's wearing a hat or that thing's wearing a Bartlet button, I'm hiding snakes in your car."

questions.text: What musical group did the President refer Leo, Toby, Josh and CJ to?
Was Fishhooks Mcarthy a real person or a Donna person?
questions.explanation:
Real person.

	Fishhooks MCarthy was a Democrat on the Lower East side of New York. Every morning he would pray the same prayer at St. James Church, "Oh, Lord, give me health and strength. We'll steal the rest." Donna told Josh that she prayed the same prayer while he was in surgery.
